abstract: Altria Group is in advanced talks to buy UST, the maker of the popular Skoal and Copenhagen smokeless tobacco brands, for more than $10 billion. The terms could not be learned.
snippet: Altria Group is in advanced talks to buy UST, the maker of the popular Skoal and Copenhagen smokeless tobacco brands, for more than $10 billion. The terms could not be learned.
lead_paragraph: Altria Group is in advanced talks to buy UST, the maker of the popular Skoal and Copenhagen smokeless tobacco brands, for more than $10 billion, people with close knowledge of the negotiations said late Thursday. The terms could not be learned.

headline.main: Altria Said to Be in Talks With Tobacco Maker UST
headline.print_headline: Altria Said to Be in Talks With Tobacco Maker UST

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Andrew Martin

abstract: Altria Group is in advanced talks to buy UST, the maker of the popular Skoal and Copenhagen smokeless tobacco brands, for more than $10 billion, The New York Times’ Andrew Ross Sorkin and Andrew Martin reported, citing people with close knowledge of the negotiations. The terms could not be learned, The Times said.
lead_paragraph: Altria Group is in advanced talks to buy UST, the maker of the popular Skoal and Copenhagen smokeless tobacco brands, for more than $10 billion, The New York Times’ Andrew Ross Sorkin and Andrew Martin reported, citing people with close knowledge of the negotiations. The terms could not be learned, The Times said.

headline.main: Altria Said to Be in Talks With Tobacco Maker UST

abstract: Shares of UST, which makes the smokeless tobacco brands Skoal and Copenhagen, surged 24 percent after the opening bell on Friday. Investors were reacting to a report in The New York Times, which said the company was in talks to be acquired by Altria for more than $10 billion.
lead_paragraph: Shares of UST, which makes the smokeless tobacco brands Skoal and Copenhagen, surged 24 percent after the opening bell on Friday. Investors were reacting to a report in The New York Times, which said the company was in talks to be acquired by Altria for more than $10 billion.

headline.main: UST’s Shares Catch Fire After Report of Deal Talks
